trustfund:
TF040692-PAPUA NEW GUINEA: GOVERNANCE
            PROMOTION ADJUSTMENT LOAN,TF039787-PAPUA NEW GUINEA - STRUCTURAL
            REFORM IN PNG,TF039747-PAPUA NEW GUINEA -  SAL III -
            STRUCTURAL REFORM

abstracts.cdata!:
The Governance Promotion Adjustment Loan
            Project for Papua New Guinea supports the government's
            ongoing efforts to redress past policy and governance
            shortcomings in a sustainable manner. Hence the loan
            includes components to improve fiscal and debt management,
            governance and civil service effectiveness, delivery of
            health and education services, forestry management, the
            quality and efficiency of financial services including those
            available through privatization, and the operating
            environment for business. A pervading theme is to strengthen
            governance in public institutions through enhanced
            transparency and accountability. Other benefits expected
            include improved public sector management capacity to
            provide core government services, a reduced public sector
            role in commercial activities, an improved climate for
            private sector development, and improved management of
            natural resources. The risks to attaining the loan's
            objectives stem for a number of factors: political
            opposition could compromise reform; weaknesses in
            implementation capacity could constrain reform
            sustainability; the government's vulnerability to
            commodity price fluctuations and natural disasters could
            undermine gains from improved policy; and high crime rates
            could weaken the supply response from ongoing reforms. In
            accordance with noted conditions, the loan will be disbursed
            in two tranches.
